DOC.brief_summary: Primary Objective : To demonstrate use glucose spar prescription , Dianeal , Extraneal , Nutrineal ( D-E-N ) versus Dianeal , diabetic ( Type 1 Type 2 ) Continuous Ambulatory Peritoneal Dialysis ( CAPD ) patient lead improved metabolic control measure magnitude change baseline value HbA1c level . Secondary Objectives : To demonstrate use glucose-sparing Peritoneal Dialysis solution ( D-E-N versus Dianeal ) diabetic ( Type 1 Type 2 ) CAPD patient lead low glycemic-control medication requirement , decrease incidence severe hypoglycemic event require medical intervention , improve metabolic control , nutritional status , Quality Life .
DOC.brief_title: Dianeal , Extraneal , Nutrineal ( D-E-N ) Versus Dianeal Only Diabetic Continuous Ambulatory Peritoneal Dialysis ( CAPD ) Patients
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male Female patient 18 year age old 2 . Diagnosis ESRD [ Glomerular Filtration Rate ( GFR ) ≤ 15 mL/min ] 3 . CAPD use Dianeal , least 1 exchange 2.5 % 4.25 % dextrose/day , prescribe dry time 4 . Diabetes Mellitus ( Type 1 2 ) 5 . HbA1c > 6.0 % ≤ 12.0 % 6 . Blood hemoglobin ≥ 8.0 g/dL , ≤ 13.0 g/dL 7 . Total Kt/V ≥ 1.7 1 . Blood Urea Nitrogen ( BUN ) > 95 mg/dL 2 . Exposure Extraneal within 60 day Screening 3 . Mean Arterial Pressure ( MAP ) ≥ 125 mm Hg , volume deplete ( MAP < 77mm Hg ) Screening 4 . Peritonitis , exitsite tunnel infection treat antibiotic within last 30 day 5 . Cardiovascular event within last 30 day 6 . Ongoing clinically significant congestive heart failure [ New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) class III IV ] 7 . Allergy starchbased polymer , glycogen storage disease isomaltose/maltose intolerance 8 . Receiving rosiglitazone maleate
